answers.answer: If the suppression test for cushings was negative, it's not likley cushings.  But a 24h urine cortisol could help confirm given the symptoms.The most common problem would be insulin resistance (ie, pre-diabetes) to cause this weight gain and many of the symptoms.  However the onset of symptoms is quicker than we usually see w/ this and your triglycerides are low (usually high in insulin resistance).

question: Found lump on anke about 6 months ago, then developed buffalo hump several months later.  Frequent pain in upper back area..feels like it would be relieved with possible chiropractic adjustment..as pain is along spinal area.in.same location as the 'bufallo hump'.Other symptoms include weight gain in stomach area over last year. (Gone from size 6 to size 10 in 2 years.  .  Generalized fatigue, lethargy, depression (significant) at times. Difficulty sleeping (staying asleep). Only medication in last 6 mo is Zoloft 150/day..Never taken steriods to my knowledge.  CBC blood work appears fine..Very low triglycerides .Despression test for Cushings negative.  24 hour urine cortisol testing has not been done..Any ideas on what to check next?
title: Ideas?
